page.title: 07WINDMILL FARM
page.content:
This 40 acre farm adjacent to the A45 is mainly used for grazing a pedigree herd of Charolais cows, with a small acreage set aside for growing potatoes.
Most interesting however is the farm building itself; this is 265 years old and served as a coaching inn between 1720 and 1820 on the main London to Hollyhead route. There is also evidence that it may have been a school in the 1880's. Now at a cost of Â£100 000 it is being transformed into a 28 bedroom motel with a 50 seat restaurant - a return to the modern equivalent of its original use.
